alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Clay; Dawson; Fillmore; Gosper; Hall; Hamilton; Kearney; Merrick; Phelps; Polk; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 8:32PM CDT until March 26 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Wet, slushy snow expected. A fairly narrow band of snow will continue developing eastward overnight, while gradually ending from west to east. In much of the Advisory area, snow amounts will likely average 1 inch or less. However, a narrow band centered roughly 10 miles either side of a line from near Elwood and Holdrege, through Hastings, Aurora and York, is more favored to receive higher amounts of 2 to 4 inches, with isolated pockets of at least 4 to 6 inches not out of the question. Winds will not be a major factor, with speeds mainly between 10 and 20 MPH, turning more northerly with time. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central and south central Nebraska, mainly including counties along the Interstate 80 and Highway 6 corridors. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CDT Sunday, although most areas will likely see snow end by 7 AM. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions anywhere that slushy snow accumulates on roads and sidewalks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Due to the main snow band likely being no more than 20 miles in width, it must be emphasized that snow amounts will vary considerably across the Advisory area. While many places will receive 1 inch or less, isolated pockets of at least 4 to 6 inches are possible within the heart of the main band.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Clay; Dawson; Fillmore; Gosper; Hall; Hamilton; Kearney; Merrick; Phelps; Polk; York
